#nametype [nametype]: 107
The sceptic is a philosopher with a sharp tongue and dry wit. His intellectual stature prevents him from accepting the truth of any faith. As the subversive words of the sceptic spread, faith in divinities falters. Sceptics are employed as missionaries of reason and are sent to foreign lands to weaken faith in false gods.
